What change in crystal morphology is observed when rod-shaped single crystals of helical P-3 are treated with pyridine?
data.answer: The morphology changes from rods to cubes.

data.question: What is the coordination geometry of the Cu ions in the helical polymer P-3?
What solvent is used as the axial ligand in the helical polymer P-3?
What is the pitch of the helical structure in the solid-state structure of P-3?
What is the role of the solvent in the reversible interconversion between the triangular macrocycle and the helical coordination polymer?
data.answer: The solvent mediates the reversible interconversion by acting as an axial ligand and affecting the solubility of the macrocycles and polymers.

data.question: How is the chirality of the resulting polymer determined in the synthesis of the helical coordination polymer?
data.answer: The chirality of the ligand precursors dictates the helicity of the resulting polymer.

data.question: What is the yield of (S)-H41 when synthesized from (S)-(+)-1,1'-binaphthyl-2,2'-diamine and 4-formyl-3-hydroxybenzoic acid?
What happens to the morphology of cube-shaped single crystals of (S,S,S)-2 when immersed in methanol?
data.answer: The morphology changes to a rod shape.

data.question: What is the significance of the Cu···Cu distance in the crystal structures of the triangular macrocycle?
data.answer: The Cu···Cu distance indicates the spatial arrangement and size of the macrocycle, affecting its structural and functional properties.

data.question: How does the solvent ratio affect the shape of the crystals obtained in the synthesis of the triangular macrocycle and helical polymer?
data.answer: A 3:10 mixture of methanol and pyridine gives cubic crystals, while a 10:1 mixture yields rod-shaped crystals.

data.question: What is the role of pyridine in the crystal structure of the triangular macrocycle?
data.answer: Pyridine acts as a ligand occupying the axial positions on the Cu centers and forms part of the small binding pockets within the macrocycle.
